datafield.subfield: [al-Jild al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat Shaykhʻzādah ʻalá al-Bayḍāwī,
Title from front flyleaf (p.1) and opening on p.3:
الجلد الثاني من تفسير شيخ زاده
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 463 v.2

Origin: As appears at close on p.454, opening section (close of Sūrat al-Baqarah) dated 987 [1579 or 80]. Further sections on anchor in circle marked paper likely contemporary ; sections on eagle "GFA" marked paper suggest 19th century.

Accompanying materials: a. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda (for the set as extant, this and Isl. Ms. 463 v.3, Isl. Ms. 463 v.5, Isl. Ms. 463 v.6 and Isl. Ms. 463 v.7) -- b. Scrap of grid paper with portion of drawing and notes (between pp.454-455).
Former shelfmark: From inner front cover, "IL 91 II" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards now covered in dull yellow paper and green-blue paper-backed cloth with dark olive green leather over spine ; Type II binding (originally with flap, though now lost) ; board linings in brown wove paper ; sewn in dark pink thread, two stations ; worked chevron endbands in cream or light yellow and dull pink, good condition ; overall in poor condition with flap apparently lost, lifting and losses of cloth and paper, abrasion, staining, delamination of boards, etc. ; housed in box for protection.

Support: European laid paper of at least two main types appearing in different sections ; opening through p.42 and pp.165-456 in a type with 10 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 27-29 mm. apart (vertical), and anchor in circle with star above watermark (68 mm. tall, see p.8, 456, etc.), sturdy, crisp and fairly thick, well-burnished to glossy ; pp.43-164 and pp.457-536 in another type with 10-11 laid lines per cm. (horizontal), chain lines spaced 27 mm. apart (vertical), and eagle with wings spread watermark ("GFA" below, see p.46, etc.), thin and fairly transluscent, burnished.

Decoration: Keywords, abbreviation symbols (mainly two teeth stroke above notable words), some notabilia (sideheads) and section headings rubricated ; overlining in red ; occasional textual dividers in the form of red discs.

Script: Naskh and nastaʻlīq (talik) ; at least four main Turkish hands ; all mainly serifless and fairly compact ; opening and other hands showing some influence of nastaʻlīq with effect of words descending to baseline, elongation of horizontal strokes, etc.
Layout: Written in 29 lines per page.

Collation: i, 7 V(70), V+1 (81), 8 V(161), IV (169), I+1 (172), 5 V(222), II+1 (227), 4 V(267), i ; chiefly quinions ; leaves between sections (pp.455-457) left blank ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes flyleaves).
Explicit: "وترك المخالفة وتلك صفة المؤمنين بالله وهم اهل السلام والكافرون"
Incipit: "سميت هذه اللام موطئة للقسم لانها تسهل على السامع تفهم جواب القسم عند اجتماع الشرط ..."

Careful copy of the second of seven volumes (v.1 and v.4 now lacking) of the commentary by Shaykhʻzādah Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Qūjawī (d.1544 or 5) upon al-Bayḍāwī's commentary on the Qurʼān, Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl, covering Sūrat al-Baqarah (2) through Sūrat Āl ʻUmrān (3). Possibly acephalous and ends abruptly.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.
Book price on front flyleaf (p.1) ; numerous glosses and marginal corrections ; occasional notabilia (sideheads), many rubricated.
[الجلد الثاني من حاشية شيخ زاده على البيضاوي,
شيخ زاده، محمد بن مصطفى القوجوي.
